name: New Mexico History Museum
reviews: Nice view of history, from the 1600s through nuclear testing after World War II. Also has nice railroad expansion displays. $12 for non resident to enter.
If your depth of knowledge about New Mexico goes no deeper than your last Frito pie - and believe me that goes real deep if you know what I mean - then you...

name: New Mexico State Capitol
address: Paseo De Peralta Old Santa Fe Trl
reviews: Don't know much about the Capitol but I sure enjoy the new Governor of New Mexico!  I appreciate you and the Mayor taking part in the Saturday festivities...
I really enjoyed New Mexico's capitol. It is the only capitol that is round and it's actually called the Round House. There is a lot of beautiful art...

This is the only round state capitol building in America and is well worth a visit inside if you're here when it's open.

You don't need a security check to...

name: Psychic Counseling And Spiritual Healing
reviews: Elissa is a very gifted intuitive and within moments I was in tears, because I could not believe how she immediately verbalized a major, life changing...

name: Escape Santa Fe
reviews: By far the worst escape room I've ever done, and the only negative experience I have ever had with an escape room. There are plenty of options when it comes...

We really enjoyed all the fun environment and creativity!

As...

name: Rockin'rollers Event Arena

name: Santa Fe Climbing Center
reviews: Great place! Their customer service is great, super friendly, and welcoming. If I'm ever in the area again, I will definitely come back.
My fiancé and I stopped in looking to familiarize ourselves with the basics of climbing. The prices are reasonable and the fun is endless. The staff is...

name: The Food Tour Company - Santa Fe
reviews: This is one great food tour. I booked the "Bites of Santa Fe" Tour. 2.5 hours and $55 dollars per person. I went with three friends and It was our first...
The Food Tour was the highlight of my trip to Santa Fe!  Thank you, Rupert!  I loved the historical information almost as much as the excellent food and...

Had a great tour with Rupert. Very knowledgeable about the food, drinks and Santa Fe and the surrounding area.
Highly recommend this tour!!

name: Tesuque Glassworks
reviews: Open 365 days a year! True to their word, they were open on Thanksgiving Day despite the snow & pretty dicey road Conditions! Beautiful glass works from...

Very talented people.  Very friendly and informative. I enjoyed watching them work there magic. 
Will have to visit them again!

name: Santa Fe River Park

9/18

name: IAIA Museum of Contemporary Native Arts
reviews:
This is a gorgeous museum. 

It's filled with extremely creative work that is thought provoking and emotional.

I love the variety of art that you see here....

Great vibe,...

the food *was* really good. it's "fine" now.
bar is great, especially at happy hour (4-6).
but it reeks of smoke to get there. really wish the restaurant...

name: Palace of the Governors
reviews:

name: Burro Alley
reviews: Want a kitschy Santa Fe moment? Stumble upon this surprise little alley... it's a short block long, with only a couple shops, an alley-wall mural or two,...

name: City of Santa Fe
reviews: For a State Capital, this place looks and feels anything but.  Temperate climate, easy pace, huge eclectic mix of people, outdoors galore, arts - much more!...
Santa Fe is a great small city. I started visiting here years ago, and have always loved it. I totally dig the vibe, the climate and the food here. New...

Santa Fe is a truly close knit community. I don't know the population numbers off hand, but it's easier felt than counted.

name: Tomasita's

name: Center For Contemporary Arts

Upon walking in my wife and I were greeted....

name: il Piatto Italian Farmhouse Kitchen
reviews:
Great restaurant! Everything I've had there was excellent. Great wine list and wines by the glass. 

BEST happy hour in Santa Fe! All apps and small pasta...

Looking forward to dinner but at 40. For a half bottle to start, we had to laugh and leave
To bad, the menu looked wonderful.

name: Railyard Arts District

name: Santa Fe Art Tours
reviews: We enjoyed the Art and Chocolate Walking Tour. Our guide took us to three galleries which gave us a diverse exposure to artists. She was knowledgeable and...
This was incredible tour with very knowledgeable guides. We had a big group and they handled the numbers well. It was fun, enlightening and...
I cannot speak highly enough of Elaine!  We were her first tour with kids under 5 and she knocked it out of the park!  The selection of galleries she chose...

name: DeVargas Center
reviews: Don't go here if you have kids! The vibe is uppity and if the kids makes any sounds a security will appear and tell you to b quiet. Which is crazy for a...

Clean mall. Weird because all stores are partially stocked. Fishing store, gun shoppe, even Ross! Empty shelves in every store. 

Feels strange. Fair...
I worked at an anchor store in this shopping mall for a while. I found it to be very "uncrowded" most of the time, except around the Christmas shopping...

name: Rail Trail
reviews: We biked the rail trails not very well marked    We enjoyed the beer break. Not much shade and bring plenty of water
Loved it!  Glad it's there-thank you New Mexico!  Awesome transportation and tourist outing.  Do it!  I highly suggest it.
This trail follows the Rail Runner Express train through Santa Fe. It's an awesome trail, and more people need to be on it! There are a few cyclists, but...

name: 30-Foot-Tall Robot & Spider
reviews:
It's part of the Meow Wolf experience located in their parking lot. There are now three metal sculptures with the third being a blue Coyote..

- Free! But...
As a Texan, I'm used to things being big. But I ain't ever seen a 30 foot robot before! This huge robot is called, "Becoming Human" and was built by...

name: New Mexico Museum of Art
reviews: What is art if not to be thought provoking? The display here on our visit certainly was that. I'd never heard of "Desert Transcendentalism", as put together...
Nice museum to go to if you have a lot of time.  $12 is a bit much for out of state visitors since the museum is pretty small with two floors.
I haven't visited the museum but the St. Francis Auditorium is gorgeous and great accoustics.  Friends have raved about concerts here. The building is...

name: Canyon Road
reviews: Whether I knew it or not, this is what I thought Santa Fe was all about - fancy art galleries with a heavy southwestern vibe. And I mean 'heavy' in every...
Returning to visit Santa Fe after 10+ years was an amazing experience that made me want to move back here, specifically in the Canyon Road area. Since we...
Canyon Road is Santa Fe's Arts District. It's an amazing walk, filled with galleries, sculpture, quaint coffee shops, you name it. One can do a combination...

name: Gryphon Helicopter Tours
reviews: I highly recommend taking a helicopter tour with Joaquin. It was a wonderful and exciting experience. Joaquin is a very experienced pilot and the helicopter...
Wonderful helicopter tour! Made my trip to Santa Fe extra special. Fantastic tour and great service. Pilot was extra safety conscious and went out of his...

name: Santa Fe Children
reviews: Santa Fe Children is a comprehensive online resource for families living in or visiting Santa Fe. Get info on Santa Fe Schools, Summer & After-school...

name: International Folk Art Market
reviews: The folk art market's an interesting place to visit, but it's important to recognize what's going on: A Western organization is bringing artisans in from...
After talking to several people about how to get here not one person mentioned it was VIP ONLY! Thanks for wasting all that time. could've been at Meowolf...
IFAM truly offers an incredible and large selection of folk arts from around the globe.  There are no bargains for trinkets here -- these are the finest...

name: Casa Chimayo Restaurant
reviews: We came here last night for dinner. We were very happy to eat here. I asked the waiter  for recommendations  and he encouraged me to try the enchiladas and...
It was one of the only restaurants open at Christmas.   At 2:30 p.m., the waitress was TIRED and unfriendly.  I understand that they were probably slammed...
Ivana  our waitress was very kind and very knowledgeable about the menu, Santa Fe and surroundings. She could have been a little more attentive to certain...

name: Santa Fe Country Club
reviews: Very friendly place, nice outdoor pool, restaurant and bar.  Great place to play golf.  They have a great golf course. You can just join for the summer to...

name: The Burger Stand At Burro Alley

I came for a burger but stayed for the chicken sandwich. 

Loaded with avocado, bacon, cheese and homemade honey mustard, this sandwich was delicious to the...

A small restaurant with a bar area to drink and eat your delicious burgers. 
They had a variety of burgers, salad, hot wings, hot dogs to order from. They...

name: Santa Fe Animal Shelter & Humane Society
reviews: Animal rescuers will probably be familiar with the emotional experience of the most difficult part of this work:  having to surrender to a new owner an...

It's a large dog park, but man are there a lot of cacti (way more and pricklier than the ones at Ortiz). 

The pups and I walked the trail around the fenced...
Awesome!!! The best shelter and it is no kill!!! Wow I am impressed.  Superbly clean and well managed.  If I were a little stray fur baby then I would hope...

name: Big River Raft Trips
reviews: Awesome Experience!!! Don't worry, it seems sketchy and parts of it is (like the path to get to lunch and where you eat lunch) but realistically they...
